channel.title: Comments on: Lens: Going (away)
channel.description: See Berlin through a lens of migration and difference

item.title: By: Max
item.dc:creator: Max
item.description: your words make me so happy.

item.title: By: collidoscope berlin
item.dc:creator: collidoscope berlin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://collidoscopeberlin.local/2013/09/16/lens-going-away/#comment-450">Bryan Miller</a>.
:) it is a rich life, indeed, though sometimes a confusing one. i get better at it every day and, of course, having those people on both sides who understand and relate makes it all worth it (like you, dad). the bikers outside of Maupin just seemed quintessentially American to me, in the way I have come to understand my relationship to this 'other side' : wild and mysterious, often a little rough at the edges, though always warm in a way only memory can make sense of...or something like that :)
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Bryan Miller
item.dc:creator: Bryan Miller
item.description: I know the airport scene and the feeling you describe. Isn't it good to have those places where you are loved, two homes across the world? I smiled at the photo of the motorcyclist parked along side of the road. I remember that spot just outside of Maupin, it too caught my eye for a brief moment.
item.content:encoded: I know the airport scene and the feeling you describe. Isn’t it good to have those places where you are loved, two homes across the world? I smiled at the photo of the motorcyclist parked along side of the road. I remember that spot just outside of Maupin, it too caught my eye for a brief moment.
